About

Hi, I’m Justin, welcome to my website.


Here I am with my first computer, it had several megabytes of ram.

Some professional background - As you can see, I am a super cool dude. For a while I ran a collocated web server, providing hosting and email services, while designing websites for local businesses. In 2008, I started work as an IT guy for F1-Networks. Eleven years later (when it became apparent that Windows was never going away) I switched things up and started programming for a local startup, Rabbu. Now I have a Macbook with several hip stickers and instead of hating Microsoft I hate REST APIs.

If you’d like to contact me, just say my name three times and I will appear. Failing that, use the contact page. Or send a hilarious tweet. Thank you for reading!


Riding Dixie through the galaxy, illustrated by Dawn Hall.

This site is built with Jekyll and uses the Pixyll theme. It is hosted on Amazon S3.

Justin is a full time software developer, part time BBQ smoker, IoT mega dorkus, and butler to Ruby (the cat).
